pull.title: docs: update README notes for /interfaces
pull.body:
- The contents of the folder have changed.
- Added a reference to the [`src/node/`](../node) folder as a prompt for further reading.

tree d6ae4b872e02d88071e267c197634bd92d64fede
parent 80e16cadd56ca73b94b01c5cd98a325fe9d89bf3

docs: update README notes for /interfaces

events.body: @RandyMcMillan it seems this PR should be moved to the main repo https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin, no?

Would you mind suggesting any improvements here? Since it is here? Then once ready - I can push it to bitcoin/bitcoin :) 

If it is good to go - I will push now.

> Would you mind suggesting any improvements here? Since it is here?

tbh, I don't see much value in these changes.
Concept ACK, I find this added context interesting.

Concept ACK

Thanks for documenting the refactors, small NIT on word choice.
small nit, @RandyMcMillan are you going to get back to this? This PR is a good addition to the documentation

verification.payload:
tree e8e484d59dee944d6775b9dcc9180f3a61f21224
parent e9f3b5906b55ecd5e45344444e28eb21a4e897c7
author @RandyMcMillan <randy.lee.mcmillan@gmail.com> 1612216720 -0500
committer randymcmillan <randy.lee.mcmillan@gmail.com> 1615171124 -0500

Update src/interfaces/README.md

Co-authored-by: Jon Atack <jon@atack.com>

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,17 +1,40 @@
-# Internal c++ interfaces
+# Internal c++ [`src/interfaces/`](../interfaces)
 
-The following interfaces are defined here:
+### The following interfaces are defined here:
 
 * [`Chain`](chain.h)  used by wallet to access blockchain and mempool state. Added in [#14437](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14437), [#14711](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14711), [#15288](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15288), and [#10973](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10973).
+	- Refactored in [#20494](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20494/commits)
 
 * [`ChainClient`](chain.h)  used by node to start & stop `Chain` clients. Added in [#14437](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14437).
 
 * [`Node`](node.h)  used by GUI to start & stop bitcoin node. Added in [#10244](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10244).
+	- Refactored in [#20494](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20494/commits)
 
 * [`Wallet`](wallet.h)  used by GUI to access wallets. Added in [#10244](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10244).
+	- Refactored in [#20494](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20494/commits)
 
 * [`Handler`](handler.h)  returned by `handleEvent` methods on interfaces above and used to manage lifetimes of event handlers.
 
-* [`Init`](init.h)  used by multiprocess code to access interfaces above on startup. Added in [#10102](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10102).
+---
+
+### Additional Notes:
+
+The [`src/node/`](../node) directory is a new directory introduced in
+[#14978](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14978) and at the moment is
+sparsely populated. Eventually more substantial files like
+[`src/validation.cpp`](../validation.cpp) and
+[`src/txmempool.cpp`](../txmempool.cpp) may be moved there.
+
+The [`src/node/`](../node) directory contains code that is needed to access node state
+(state in `CChain`, `CBlockIndex`, `CCoinsView`, `CTxMemPool`, and similar
+classes).
+
+---
+
+* [`Init`](../init.h)  used by multiprocess code to access interfaces above on startup. Added in [#10102](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10102).
+
+
+---
 
 The interfaces above define boundaries between major components of bitcoin code (node, wallet, and gui), making it possible for them to run in different processes, and be tested, developed, and understood independently. These interfaces are not currently designed to be stable or to be used externally.
comments.body:
```suggestion
The interfaces above define boundaries between major components of bitcoin code (node, wallet, and gui), making it possible for them to run in different processes and be tested, developed, and understood independently. These interfaces are not currently designed to be stable or to be used externally.
```
Might want to leave this as just "interfaces", as you also discuss `src/node`

-The following interfaces are defined here:
+### The following interfaces are defined here:
 
 * [`Chain`](chain.h)  used by wallet to access blockchain and mempool state. Added in [#14437](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14437), [#14711](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14711), [#15288](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15288), and [#10973](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10973).
+	- Refactored in [#20494](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20494/commits)
 
 * [`ChainClient`](chain.h)  used by node to start & stop `Chain` clients. Added in [#14437](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14437).
 
 * [`Node`](node.h)  used by GUI to start & stop bitcoin node. Added in [#10244](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10244).
+	- Refactored in [#20494](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20494/commits)
 
 * [`Wallet`](wallet.h)  used by GUI to access wallets. Added in [#10244](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10244).
+	- Refactored in [#20494](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20494/commits)
comments.body: Perhaps drop the `/commits` path in the URL and add this line in one place only, referring to chain/node/wallet.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,17 +1,39 @@
-# Internal c++ interfaces
+# Internal c++ [`src/interfaces/`](../interfaces)
 
-The following interfaces are defined here:
+### The following interfaces are defined here:
 
 * [`Chain`](chain.h)  used by wallet to access blockchain and mempool state. Added in [#14437](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14437), [#14711](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14711), [#15288](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15288), and [#10973](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10973).
+	- Refactored in [#20494](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20494/commits)
 
 * [`ChainClient`](chain.h)  used by node to start & stop `Chain` clients. Added in [#14437](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14437).
 
 * [`Node`](node.h)  used by GUI to start & stop bitcoin node. Added in [#10244](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10244).
+	- Refactored in [#20494](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20494/commits)
 
 * [`Wallet`](wallet.h)  used by GUI to access wallets. Added in [#10244](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10244).
+	- Refactored in [#20494](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20494/commits)
 
 * [`Handler`](handler.h)  returned by `handleEvent` methods on interfaces above and used to manage lifetimes of event handlers.
 
-* [`Init`](init.h)  used by multiprocess code to access interfaces above on startup. Added in [#10102](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10102).
+---
 
-The interfaces above define boundaries between major components of bitcoin code (node, wallet, and gui), making it possible for them to run in different processes, and be tested, developed, and understood independently. These interfaces are not currently designed to be stable or to be used externally.
+### Additional Notes:
+
+The [`src/node/`](../node) directory is a new directory introduced in
+[#14978](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14978) and at the moment is
+sparsely populated. Eventually more substantial files like
+[`src/validation.cpp`](../validation.cpp) and
+[`src/txmempool.cpp`](../txmempool.cpp) may be moved there.
comments.body: Might be good to link to a source for this last sentence.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,4 +19,4 @@ The [`src/node/`](./) directory is a new directory introduced in
 [#14978](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14978) and at the moment is
 sparsely populated. Eventually more substantial files like
 [`src/validation.cpp`](../validation.cpp) and
-[`src/txmempool.cpp`](../txmempool.cpp) might be moved there.
+[`src/txmempool.cpp`](../txmempool.cpp) may be moved there.
comments.body:
small NIT 

feel free to ignore this, don't want this to get caught up on this word choice

While `may` can be used in a scenario signaling possibility, it is primarily used in the context of signaling permission to do something. Considering the context, I believe that `might` is the correct choice here.

comments.body:
nit, I believe GUI is supposed to be capitalized
```suggestion
The interfaces above define boundaries between major components of bitcoin code (node, wallet, and GUI), making it possible for them to run in different processes and be tested, developed, and understood independently. These interfaces are not currently designed to be stable or to be used externally.
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,4 +19,4 @@ The [`src/node/`](./) directory is a new directory introduced in
 [#14978](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14978) and at the moment is
 sparsely populated. Eventually more substantial files like
 [`src/validation.cpp`](../validation.cpp) and
-[`src/txmempool.cpp`](../txmempool.cpp) might be moved there.
+[`src/txmempool.cpp`](../txmempool.cpp) may be moved there.
comments.body: I prefer "may" and disagree with the comment that it is primarily about permission instead of possibiity; both are auxiliary definitions of the word and it's clear that the context here is about possibility.
